text: Dame Margaret Georgina Constance Guilfoyle (née McCartney; 15 May 1926 - 11 November 2020) was an Australian politician. She is a member of the Liberal Party. She served as a Senator for Victoria from 1971 to 1987. She was the first woman minister to administer a government department. She served as a minister for in the Fraser Government as Minister for Education (1975), Minister for Social Security (1975–1980) and Minister for Finance (1980–1983). Guilfoyle was born in Belfast, Northern Ireland. Her family moved to Australia in 1928, settling in Melbourne, Victoria. In 1952, she married Stanley Guilfoyle. The couple had three children. Guilfoyle died on 11 November 2020, aged 94.Obituary in The Age (Melbourne) , 19 November 2020. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Government ministers of Australia Category:Knights and Dames Commander of the Order of the British Empire Category:Liberal Party of Australia politicians Category:Members of the Australian Senate Category:Order of Australia Category:Politicians from Belfast Category:Politicians from Melbourne
